title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - C.52 (WW-I, WW-II 3)
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 52 (WW-I, WW-II 3):

We have 35 titles here. Note that in the Torrent name the word "Collection" is replaced with "C." because the name length is limited to 62 characters. 

-  Baker - Human Smoke; the Beginnings of World War II, the End of Civilization (2008)

-  Bell - The Origins of the Second World War in Europe, 3e (2007)

-  Best - Five Days That Shocked the World; Eyewitness Account from Europe at the End of World War II (2011)

-  Burleigh - Moral Combat; a History of World War II (2010)

-  Chickering et al (Eds.) - A World at Total War; Global Conflict and the Politics of Destruction, 1937-1947 (2005)

-  Clark - The Sleepwalkers; How Europe Went to War in 1914 (2012)

-  Clay - King, Kaiser, Tsar; Three Royal Cousins Who Led the World to War (2006)

-  Deak - Europe on Trial; the Story of Collaboration, Resistance, and Retribution During World War II (2015)

-  Doenecke - Nothing Less Than War; a New History of America's Entry into World War I (2011)

-  Ferguson - The Abyss; World War I and the End of the First Age of Globalization (2012)

-  Freemantle - Gas! Gas! Quick, Boys! How Chemistry Changed the First World War (2012)

-  Furedi - First World War; Still No End in Sight (2014)

-  Gluckstein - A People's History of the Second World War; Resistance Versus Empire (2012)

-  Grimsrud - The Good War That Wasn't, and Why It Matters; World War II's Moral Legacy (2014)

-  Harris - Blitz Diary; Life Under Fire in World War II (2010)

-  Hasting - Inferno; the World at War, 1939-1945 (2011)

-  Jenkins - The Great and Holy War; How World War I Became a Religious Crusade (2014)

-  Kennedy - The Shock of War; Civilian Experience, 1037-1945 (2011)

-  Lambert - Planning Armageddon; British Economic Warfare and the First World War (2012)

-  Longmate - How We Lived Then; a History of Everyday Life During the Second World War (1971)

-  Lowe - Inferno; the Devastation of Hamburg, 1943 (2007)

-  Maiolo - Cry Havoc; How the Arm Race Drove the World to War, 1931-1941 (2010)

-  Martel - The Month That Changed the World, July 1914 (2014)

-  Mayhew - Wounded; a New History of the Western Front in World War I (2014)

-  McMeekin - The Russian Origins of the First World War (2011)

-  Merten - Forgotten Voices; the Expulsion of the Germans from Eastern Europe after World War II (2012)

-  Oxlade - World War I; Secret History (2010)

-  Plunkett - Death by Mustard Gas; How Military Secrecy and Lost Weapons Can Kill (2014)

-  Preston - A Higher Form of Killing; Six Weeks in World War I That Forever Changed the Nature of Warfare (2015)

-  Reynolds - The Long Shadow; the Legacies of the Great War in the Twentieth Century (2014)

-  Shephard - The Long Road Home; the Aftermath of the Second World War (2010)

-  Toland - The Last 100 Years; the Tumultuous and Controversial Story of the Final Days of World War II in Europe (2003)

-  Warner - World War II; the Untold Story (1988)

-  Wawro - A Mad Catastrophe; the Outbreak of World War I and the Collapse of the Habsburg Empire (2014)

-  Zurbrugg (Ed.) - Not Our War; Writings against the First World War (2014)
